snippet: Those considering equine ownership need to take into account not only the purchase price, but also upkeep, insurance, veterinary bills and entry fees.
abstract: Parents thinking about buying a horse for their child must be prepared that total spending for animal's upkeep will be far greater than the cost to buy it, and that costs can continue for decades; most say, even with cost of insurance, equipment and veterinary bills, experience is worthwhile because horses offer life lessons in responsibility.
lead_paragraph: Those considering equine ownership need to take into account not only the purchase price, but also upkeep, insurance, veterinary bills and entry fees.

headline.main: The True Cost of ‘Daddy, Can I Have a Pony?’
headline.print_headline: The True Cost of ‘Daddy, Can I Have a Pony?’
